column4: I've seen this bug before, looking for a solution right now, although my browser has decided to take a nap, just a moment.
thanks
Is the exact error: "No such file or directory - /tmp/mysql.sock"
no. Please see here: http://pastie.org/2128975
Do you have data in this database that you need to keep?
no, it's a fresh install
Okay, lets try this then: sudo apt-get purge mysql-server-5.1 && sudo rm /var/lib/mysql && sudo apt-get install mysql-server-5.1
rm: cannot remove `/var/lib/mysql': Is a directory - should I do rm -rf and add a / ?
yes, please. sorry.
http://pastie.org/2128975
Can you gain interactive access to mysql now?
no, same exact error
I'm finding so many people having this same issue, but all with different solutions.
I have been googling for two days...what's the most recent ubuntu without this upstart thing?
Ranging from for some reason /etc/mysql/my.cnf is missing, to being out of disk space, to /etc/init/mysql.conf missing a space.
8.04 iirc.
Althoug 10.04 had less upstartisms
:( too old, I need php 5.3... my mysql.conf is not missing a space (just checked), I have plenty of space, my.cnf is where it should be...
You could try asking in #mysql and/or #ubuntu-server as well.
Sorry I couldn't be of more help.
no problem :) thank you
